version_description: Marking as read by jumping to the top of the timeline didn't always work correctly on a iPhone X

+ The in app Web browser now respects the navigation bar color scheme of the rest of the app when using iOS 10 or higher
+ Improved navigation between images when a Tweet contains more than one photo

Bug Fixes:
- Choosing a video from the new media picker uploaded the first frame as a photo in error
- When attaching a video to a Tweet on the compose screen, the video thumbnail didn't show
- When choosing a GIF to attach to a Tweet, previewing the GIF in the full image viewer didn't animate

+ Reply with hashtags setting will automatically include any hashtags from a Tweet you reply to

Bug Fixes:
- Fix a scrolling issue on Tweet view when conversation is shown
- Fix more position issues under iOS 11 when resuming from background

+ Hugely improved look and feel to multiple images in a Tweet when on the timeline
+ When replying to a Tweet, tap and screen names, hashtags or links in the reply Tweet to include in your text

+ Hugely improved look and feel to multiple images in a Tweet when on the timeline
+ When replying to a Tweet, tap and screen names, hashtags or links in the reply Tweet to include in your text

+ See if you are following someone, and follow them if you're not directly from user lists
+ Improvements to the Search tab

Feature Changes:
- Moved some settings around to make it easier
- Moved classic retweet options to their own menu for simpler retweeting

Bug Fixes:
- When searching a timeline, Tweets with videos or photos attached didn't show them

+ Added a new Bookmarks feature. Long press a link on the timeline or tap the button from the Tweet View to save a link for viewing later on
+ Improvements to the user interface of alerts
- Settings is no longer a navigation item but can be accessed by going to the More tab and tapping settings at the top left of the screen (or by going to the account drawer as before)

+ You can now prevent accidentally sending Tweets or Direct Messages by requiring Face ID or Touch ID
+ New section in the settings detailing what keyboard shortcuts are available when you have a bluetooth keyboard attached

+ On media timeline you can now swipe between photos
= Pitch black theme navigation bar is now totally black and not translucent. Even more gorgeous on an iPhone X OLED screen
= Website links from status view inline conversation didn't open web browser

Due to a change in Twitter's rules, users and therefore also apps are no longer allowed to simultaneously post a Tweet from multiple accounts.  We've removed this feature now to comply with this new rule.  You can still post from another account from the compose screen, just not multiple accounts

Bookmark Tweets. In addition to bookmarking Web links, you can now bookmark Tweets to come back to later directly in Tweetings.

These bookmarks are entirely local to the app and not shared with other apps or Twitter themselves.

+ Improvements to the look and feel of quoted Tweets
+ Tab bar on pitch black theme is now totally black to look even better on iPhone X
In this version we've made improvements to the search screen loading offline data
Fixes and performance improvements to the search screen

+ Quoted Tweets are now shown on the Apple Watch app timeline

Bug Fixes:
- Fix a crash when reordering the compose menu options
Updates to some third party libraries, improved performance and removed some error messages when resuming from background
Improvements to the search screen and minor fixes to the user experience

- Fixes for replying on Apple Watch
- UI fixes for quoted tweets
Updated the support iOS 11.4
Removal of the streaming feature as Twitter is imminently retiring this from their platform

- Switch to the new Direct Message API in advance of Twitter's sunsetting of the old API
- Removed the streaming feature as it'll be turned off imminently by Twitter

+ Improvements to keyboard shortcuts
- Fixes to direct message loading
- Fixes for Instagram photos sometimes not loading on the timeline

+ Support for iOS 12
- Improvements to timeline searching and the search tab
- Improvements to keyboard shortcuts on the timeline
Push notifications for mentions could accidentally be duplicated
Improvements to user lists, especially when the account is verified
Support for Apple Watch Series 4
Squashed a number of bugs relating to displaying the maps on Tweets that have had a location attached to them

Performance improvements
Bug fixes
Removed google link shortener

Bet you thought we were sleeping, it's been a while since we made a major update. Well here it is, version 4.0 with with it we've merged Tweetings for iPhone and Tweetings for iPad into one Universal app.

This will allow us to bring updates to both iPhone and iPad at the same time, and bringing feature parity from the iPhone version to iPad.

Changelog:

+ Tweetings is now a Universal app now also supporting iPad and iPad Pro
+ You can now muffle user's directly from a Tweet without needing to go to their profile
+ Drag and drop support on iPads. Drag photos from the status view, drag Tweets on the timeline or drop photos and text onto the New Tweet screen
+ Added a share icon to timeline Tweets

Changes:
- Default timeline font size increased by default for new installs on iPhone Plus, iPhone X, Xs and Xs Max

Bug Fixes:
- Unable to filter saved searches by media
- Fixed some unresponsive menus when in accessibility mode
- Long pressing a link on the timeline to save to bookmarks didn't always work

+ Drag and drop support on iPads. Drag photos from the status view, drag Tweets on the timeline or drop photos and text onto the New Tweet screen
+ Added a share icon to timeline Tweets

Bet you thought we were sleeping, it's been a while since we made a major update. Well here it is, version 4.0 with with it we've merged Tweetings for iPhone and Tweetings for iPad into one Universal app.
This will allow us to bring updates to both iPhone and iPad at the same time, and bringing feature parity from the iPhone version to iPad.
Changelog:

+ Tweetings is now a Universal app now also supporting iPad and iPad Pro
+ You can now muffle user's directly from a Tweet without needing to go to their profile
+ Drag and drop support on iPads. Drag photos from the status view, drag Tweets on the timeline or drop photos and text onto the New Tweet screen
+ Added a share icon to timeline Tweets

Changes:
- Default timeline font size increased by default for new installs on iPhone Plus, iPhone X, Xs and Xs Max

Bug Fixes:
- Unable to filter saved searches by media
- Fixed some unresponsive menus when in accessibility mode
- Long pressing a link on the timeline to save to bookmarks didn't always work

**Version 4.0.2 brings**
- Upgraded some internal iOS frameworks to more modern versions for better performance and reliability
- Multiple timeline images on iPhone could be corrupted, didn't affect iPad

+ Improved direct messages layout on iPad
+ Improved stacked timeline layout on iPad

Changes:
- New keyboard shortcuts to copy Tweet text or Tweet links on Tweet view
- Changed the default navigation item order for new installations

Bug Fixes:
- Long press options on the tab bar for iPad were mis-placed
- Fixed a few crashes submitted

Removed TweetMarker as the service has closed down.  If you previously used TweetMarker and had it configured in the app, we've automatically switched you to Tweetings Sync, which you can turn off in settings if you'd like

- Support for iOS 13 including automatic dark mode
- We've reimagined some of our dark themes, inspired by the native iOS dark theme
- You can now pick alternative app icons from the Look & Feel settings

Context menu support for devices without 3D touch running on iOS 13

Bug fixes in this version:
- Context menus didn't always work on devices without 3D touch
- Retweet button on Tweet view always shown as selected
Improvements to a number of areas of the app that didn't respect system dark mode

- Performance improvements to Tweets loading
- Scrolling performance improvements
